attributes.name: RecordReference
attributes.description:
A `RecordReference` is a low-level API that allows users and
addon authors to perform meta-operations on a record.

methods.description:
The `id` of the record that this reference refers to.

Together, the `type` and `id` properties form a composite key for
the identity map.

Example

```javascript
let userRef = store.getReference('user', 1);

userRef.id(); // '1'
```
methods.name: id

methods.description:
The `identifier` of the record that this reference refers to.

Together, the `type` and `id` properties form a composite key for
the identity map.

Example

```javascript
let userRef = store.getReference('user', 1);

userRef.identifier(); // '1'
```
methods.name: identifier

methods.description:
How the reference will be looked up when it is loaded. Currently
this always returns `identity` to signify that a record will be
loaded by its `type` and `id`.

Example

```javascript
const userRef = store.getReference('user', 1);

userRef.remoteType(); // 'identity'
```
methods.name: remoteType
push

params.name: objectOrPromise
params.description: a JSON:API ResourceDocument or a promise resolving to one

return.description: a promise for the value (record or relationship)

methods.description:
If the entity referred to by the reference is already loaded, it is
present as `reference.value`. Otherwise the value returned by this function
is `null`.

 Example

 ```javascript
 let userRef = store.getReference('user', 1);

 userRef.value(); // user
 ```
methods.name: value

methods.description:
Triggers a fetch for the backing entity based on its `remoteType`
(see `remoteType` definitions per reference type).

Example

```javascript
let userRef = store.getReference('user', 1);

// load user (via store.find)
userRef.load().then(...)
```
methods.name: load

methods.description:
Reloads the record if it is already loaded. If the record is not
loaded it will load the record via `store.findRecord`

Example

```javascript
let userRef = store.getReference('user', 1);

// or trigger a reload
userRef.reload().then(...)
```
methods.name: reload
